messages.message: How do we get that turned into core functionality vs just UDF's?
There’s two approaches we are currently following 1) we own the Flow Binary process completely 2) we give them the initial ibprog / Flow, and then they maintain the updates
there is a 3) product-version which allows them to specify via configs the columns / fields they want exported
we don’t have the bandwidth to add such a feature / it doesn’t have high enough priority since we have an alternative currently

I mean in general seems we create new functionality in the case Kerrys UDF's. How can we make them more resuable. I would love to be able to show DHL here is how you do things without having it as a bunch of code or UDF but a nice refiner function or a flow step or something like that
I get the bandwidth for it but don't want to have this unknown library of UDF's that is hard to sell to customers...
The use case we did for you that we promise is repetable or easy to do is secretly a bunch of custom work
Yeah, i think technically it’s very doable (basically just need a UI wrapper for a step that is essentially an apply UDF)
if we all agree this is useful, I can create an Asana task and have that in the next (?) release.
